newsitem.title: GERMANY: Thyssen -Krupp to make takeover bid.
newsitem.headline: Thyssen -Krupp to make takeover bid.

text.p: German steel and engineering group Thyssen AG said on Monday its rival Krupp's was preparing to make a hostile takeover bid which it would defend with "appropriate means."

The news recalled Fried. Krupp AG Krupp-Hoesch's spectacular surprise takeover of rival Hoesch AG in 1991 which combined Germany's second and third largest steel makers and led to speculation of a further consolidation in the sector.

"We are unconcerned about this attempt," a Thyssen spokesman told Reuters. "This can only be an attempt on the part of Krupp to resolve its own considerable problems by tapping into Thyssen's reserves."
The spokesman added that Thyssen would use all "appropriate means" to counter any hostile takeover attempt and said the company had called a news conference for Tuesday afternoon.

A takeover of Thyssen by Krupp would be an "incomprehensible act in the style of the Wild West", the spokesman added which would set off a restructuring programme that would cost tens of thousands of jobs.
Thyssen's statement followed the advance release of a report to appear in the daily Frankfurter Allgemeine Zeitung on Tuesday, which said Krupp was planning to make an offer to Thyssen shareholders.
The offer was being prepared by Deutsche Morgan Grenfell, the investment arm of Deutsche Bank, the report said.
"We will not comment on these rumours now," said Krupp spokesman Juergen Claassen. "We will issue a press release shortly."
A spokesman for Deutsche Morgan Grenfell in London said the bank never commented on market rumours as a general policy.
